pullRequest.title: Release/1.0.0 rc 1
pullRequest.bodyText:
Description
Release commits pending tagging and CI executions
Type of change


 Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
 Feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
 Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to change
 Chore (non-breaking change which doesn't affect codebase;
test, version modification, documentation, etc.)

Checklist

 I have read the contributing guidelines
 I signed-off my commit with a user that has signed the Eclipse Contributor Agreement

commit.message:
[RELEASE] Updated project version to 1.0.0-rc-1

Signed-off-by: Marc Nuri <marc@marcnuri.com>

nodes.bodyText: Please add the release date too

beforeCommit.message:
[RELEASE] Prepare for next development iteration

Signed-off-by: Marc Nuri <marc@marcnuri.com>

afterCommit.message:
[RELEASE] Prepare for next development iteration

Signed-off-by: Marc Nuri <marc@marcnuri.com>

nodes.bodyText: Not sure whether it should be here, but do you think we should add a section on migrating to JKube from FMP. At this point, our target audience is people currently using FMP
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -101,9 +101,11 @@ function emailTemplate() {
   changelogLinksCount=$(echo -e "$changelogLinks" | wc -l)
   githubLinkId="["$((changelogLinksCount + 2))"]"
   gitterLinkId="["$((changelogLinksCount + 3))"]"
-  lines="Release announcement for Eclipse JKube $1

"
-  lines+="Hi All,

"
-  lines+="We are pleased to announce Eclipse JKube $1 was just released. You can find the release at Maven Central [1].

"
+  lines="[ANNOUNCE] Eclipse JKube $1 released

"
+  lines+="Hi Everyone,

"
+  lines+="We are pleased to announce Eclipse JKube $1 was just released! You can find the release at Maven Central [1].

"
+  lines+="Eclipse JKube is a collection of plugins and libraries that are used for building container images using Docker, JIB or S2I build strategies.
Eclipse JKube generates and deploys Kubernetes/OpenShift manifests at compile time too.

"
+  lines+="Using this release:

<plugin>
  <groupId>org.eclipse.jkube</groupId>
  <artifactId>kubernetes-maven-plugin</artifactId>
  <version>$1</version
</plugin>

(Check Maven Central [1] for the rest of artifacts)

"
